intro: Ebenus vieillardii, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and northern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, often growing in crevices and on slopes. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Ebenus vieillardii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
